Material used.Description: HEK293 and DJ-1 -/- MEF cells were cultured in DMEM supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum without antibiotics.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced steady-state protein levels of M26I DJ-1, particularly in DJ-1 knockout MEF cells.
L166P mutation dramatically destabilizes the protein.
C106A mutation abolishes binding to ASK1 and cytoprotective activity.
C46A mutation reduces protein stability but retains cytoprotective activity.
C53A mutation retains cytoprotective activity and binds to ASK1 even in basal state.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed independently at least two times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for protein expression and cytoprotective activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance with Bonferroni multiple comparisons post test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels comparable to wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in protein expression levels compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Material used.Description: HEK293E cells were transiently co-transfected with constructs encoding ASK1 and DJ-1 mutants.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I DJ-1 constitutively binds to an aberrant site on ASK1, failing to suppress ASK1 activity.
L166P mutation results in loss of function, though specific binding data not detailed in this context.
C106A mutation abolishes binding to ASK1.
C46A mutation retains constitutive binding to ASK1.
C53A mutation retains constitutive binding to ASK1.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are representative of two or three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 binding to ASK1 after H2O2 treatment was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding to ASK1 after H2O2 treatment similar to wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Failure to bind ASK1 or aberrant binding site compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Material used.Description: Immortalized DJ-1 -/- MEF cells were transfected with DJ-1 expression constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I DJ-1 shows significantly reduced cytoprotection against H2O2-induced stress.
L166P mutation results in complete loss of cytoprotective activity.
C106A mutation completely loses cytoprotective activity.
C46A mutation retains cytoprotective activity.
C53A mutation retains cytoprotective activity.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are representative of two independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Triplicate samples were used for LDH release assays.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 transfection conferred significant cytoprotection.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance with Bonferroni multiple comparisons post test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cytotoxicity levels (LDH release) comparable to wild-type DJ-1 after H2O2 exposure.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly higher cytotoxicity levels (LDH release) compared to wild-type DJ-1 after H2O2 exposure.

Material used.Description: Stably back-transfected DJ-1 -/- MEF cell lines were transfected with pRK5-FLAG-Daxx.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I DJ-1 fails to suppress nuclear export of Daxx after H2O2 treatment.
L166P mutation likely fails to suppress Daxx translocation, though not specifically tested.
C106A mutation likely fails to suppress Daxx translocation, though not specifically tested.
C46A mutation likely retains ability to suppress Daxx translocation, though not specifically tested.
C53A mutation likely retains ability to suppress Daxx translocation, though not specifically tested.

Biological replicates.Description: Mean values from three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 abolished nuclear export of FLAG/Daxx.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control showed significant increase in cytosolic FLAG/Daxx staining.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance with Bonferroni multiple comparisons post test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Suppression of nuclear export of Daxx similar to wild-type DJ-1 after H2O2 treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Failure to suppress nuclear export of Daxx compared to wild-type DJ-1 after H2O2 treatment.
